messages.content: is it ok to buy a new iPhone a s then sell it immediately or will apple get mad

It's generally okay to buy a new iPhone and then sell it immediately. Apple won't get mad at you for doing this. Once you purchase a product, it's yours to keep, give away, or sell. However, it's important to sell it through legitimate channels and ensure that the transaction is legal and ethical. Additionally, be aware of any terms and conditions that might apply when you first purchase the iPhone, especially if it's bought under a contract or financing plan.
Ok so it’s not tied to my account.

That's correct. When you buy a new iPhone, it is not inherently tied to your account. However, once you set it up using your Apple ID, it becomes associated with your account. If you plan to sell the iPhone immediately and have not set it up or linked it to your Apple ID, then it's not tied to your account. 

If you have already set it up, you should erase all content and settings to remove

Yes, if the iPhone is unopened and you haven't set it up with your Apple ID, it's absolutely fine to sell it. It won't be tied to your account in any way in this state. Just make sure to follow any applicable laws and guidelines for resale in your area.
